metadata.title: CVE-2020-14381 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s futex implementation. This flawallows a local attacker to corrupt system memory or escalate theirprivileges when creating a futex on a filesystem that is about to beunmounted. The highest threat from this vulnerability is toconfidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14381` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-53-generic - 5.3.0-53.47~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-53.47~18.04.1').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.60').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.70').
